description: Learn the left hand home row keys
instruction: Lessons begin with the home keys for the left hands: 'ASDF' Place your left hand fingers over the 'A' key; ring finger over 'S'; middle finger over 'D'; and index finger over 'F'. Keep the fingers curved, relaxed and poised just over the home keys.

description: Learn the right hand home row keys
instruction: The next lesson introduces a new home key: 'J'. Use the index finger of the right hand to strike the 'J' key. Remember to position your fingers over the home keys and reach from there to all other parts of the keyboard.

description: Practice all home row keys together
instruction: The next lesson introduces a new home key: 'K'. Use the middle finger of the right hand to strike the 'K' key. Remember to position your fingers over the home keys and reach from there to all other parts of the keyboard.

The next lesson introduces a new home key: 'L'. Use the ring finger of the right hand to strike the 'L' key. Remember to position your fingers over the home keys and reach from there to all other parts of the keyboard.

The next lesson introduces a new home key: ';'. Use the little finger of the right hand to strike the ';' key. Remember to position your fingers over the home keys and reach from there to all other parts of the keyboard.
Use your left middle finger to strike both the 'D' and 'E' keys.
Use your right middle finger to strike both the 'K' and 'I' keys.
i
Use your left index finger to strike both the 'F' and 'R' keys.
i
Use your left index finger to strike both the 'F' and 'T' keys.
Use your right index finger to strike both the 'J' and 'Y' keys.
i
Use your right ring finger to strike both the 'L' and O keys
i
Use your right little finger to strike both the ';' and 'P' keys.
Use your right index finger to strike both the 'J' and 'H' keys.
Use your left middle3 finger to strike both the 'D' and 'C' keys.
Use your right index finger to strike both the 'J' and 'N' keys.
i
i
i
Use your right middle finger to strike bother the 'K' and ',' keys.
i
Use your right ring finger to strike both the 'L' and '.' keys.

So far, lessons have used lower case characters only.  New lessons will use upper case letters as well.  Upper case letters are typed by holding down a Shift key at the same time the letter is pressed. There are two Shift keys, one for each hand.  Hold the Shift key down with the little finger of one hand and type the letter with the correct finger on the other hand. For example. To typ an upper case 'E', press the Shift key on the rightr side of the keyboard with the right little finger. While holding the Shift key down, press the 'E' key with the left middle finger.
numbers
Reach up with your left-hand fingers to type the numbers '1', '2', and '3'. Practice typing the numbers in sequence
Reach up with your left-hand index finger to type the number '4'. Practice typing the number sequences.
Reach up with your right-hand index finger to type the number '6'. Practice typing the number sequences.
Reach up with your right-hand index finger to type the number '7'. Practice typing the number sequences.
Reach up with your right-hand middle finger to type the number '8'. Practice typing the number sequences.
